Then we can feed these regions one-by-one into an open source OCR library that runs in javascript.

Notice anything about the previous image?

... and use this to classify each row of pixels in the image.

We model an interactive narrative as a path through a high-dimensional parameter space. The parameters drive the behavior of functional components.

Authors can define a trajectory through this space, as well as regions that readers should be able to explore on their own. https://t.co/7rOxayuMLG

We achieve this by raising the level of abstraction at which you're writing. 

Instead of specifying particular layouts, you provide the structure for a high-level narrative, and the system figures out how to map that on to one of the output formats https://t.co/bLbfZohktX

The compiler can be used to generate five different output formats: static articles (pdf), low-motion articles, interactive articles, slideshows, and videos

With Fidyll you end up writing 80-90% less markup compared to crafting each of these articles by hand https://t.co/PFWDwDEHp2

The poverty gap index is often described as a measure of the depth of poverty. That‚Äôs not false, but is open to misinterpretation.

A big downside of the poverty gap index though is that it‚Äôs not so easy to understand.

Importantly, while there are now more conflicts than in the past, many fewer people die in them.

The number of conflicts involving at least one government has increased.
